clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Oral Moisturizing Jelly on Oral Health and Nutrition in Post-radiotherapy Head and Neck Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial for Efficacy of Oral Moisturizing Jelly on Oral Health and Nutrition in Post-radiotherapy Head and Neck Cancer Patients With Xerostomia

lead_sponsor.agency: Dental Innovation Foundation Under Royal Patronage

clinical_study.source: Dental Innovation Foundation Under Royal Patronage

brief_summary.textblock: This randomized control trial aims to investigate the efficacy of oral moisturizing jelly in head and neck cancer patients with xerostomia.

detailed_description.textblock: Oral moisturizing jelly is a novel edible, gel-based artificial saliva. It has been proven effective in reducing dry mouth sign and symptoms in elderly patients with xerostomia. This randomized control trial intends to determine if continuous use of oral moisturizing jelly may be effective in reduction of signs and symptoms of dry mouth, improvement of biochemical properties of saliva, subjective swallow ability, appetite, tolerance to spicy food, energy intake and reduce umami taste recognition threshold.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in subjective dry mouth score compared to baseline
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of subjective dry mouth score by questionaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in objective dry mouth score compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of objective dry mouth score by oral examination

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in salivary pH compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of salivary pH using pH indicator paper

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in salivary buffering capacity compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of salivary buffering capacity using a commercial saliva check buffer kit

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Candidal counts of saliva compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of number of fungal colonies of Candida spp. in saliva by culture

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in energy intake compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of energy intake per day using dietary record and analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in subjective swallow ability compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of subjective swallow ability using EAT-10 questionaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in appetite compared to baseline
Changes in tolerance to spicy food
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of tolerance to spicy food using questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in umami taste recognition threshold compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of umami taste recognition threshold using filter paper disc method

arm_group.description: Daily intake of oral moisturizing jelly 5 times/day for two months
Daily use of non-edible oral lubricating gel 5 times/day for two months

intervention.description: Gel-based artificial saliva is an edible non-nutritious gel intended to relieve dry mouth
A non-edible oral lubricating gel for dry mouth patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Xerostomic head and neck cancer patients who finish radiotherapy for at least 1 month.
2. If undergoing chemotherapy, have to finish for at least 2 weeks.
3. Have subjective dry mouth scores at least 3
4. Can perform oral intake without aspiration
5. Can communicate well
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Has recurrence of cancer
2. Has mucositis more than grade 1
3. Has oral infection such as candidiasis
